hints_html:
What happens if you simply plug in -2 in the function? What does it mean? What can you do about that?

Evaluating at -2 gives 0/0 which is undefined. This means we just don’t know anything about what the limit might be (it could be anything). So we need to deal with that. Notice that the function is a rational function (a fraction with polynomials in both numerator and denominator), since each are 0 at t=-2, it means that -2 is a root of each and hence, they can be factorized.

root of each and hence, they can be factorized.
hints_raw:
What happens if you simply plug in -2 in the function? What does it mean? What can you do about that?
Evaluating at -2 gives 0/0 which is undefined. This means we just don't know anything about what the limit might be (it could be anything). So we need to deal with that. Notice that the function is a rational function (a fraction with polynomials in both numerator and denominator), since each are 0 at ''t''=-2, it means that -2 is a root of each and hence, they can be factorized.
question: 1 (a)
sols_html:
When we evaluate the function at \(t=-2\) we obtain 0/0. Since this is a rational function, it means that we can factor \(t+2\) in each of the denominator and numerator:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 2t^2+t-6 = (t+2)(2t-3)\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle t^2-4 = (t+2)(t-2)\end{aligned}\]

Hence

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{t \to -2}\frac{2t^2+t-6}{t^2-4} &= \lim_{t \to -2}\frac{(t+2)(2t-3)}{(t+2)(t-2)}\\ &= \lim_{t \to -2}\frac{(2t-3)}{(t-2)}\\ &= \frac{2(-2)-3}{(-2)-2}\\ &= \frac{7}{4}\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
When we evaluate the function at $t=-2$ we obtain 0/0. Since this is a
rational function, it means that we can factor $t+2$ in each of the
denominator and numerator:

\begin{align*}
\displaystyle
2t^2+t-6 = (t+2)(2t-3)
\end{align*} and

\begin{align*}
\displaystyle
t^2-4 = (t+2)(t-2)
\end{align*} Hence

\begin{align*}
\lim_{t \to -2}\frac{2t^2+t-6}{t^2-4} &= \lim_{t \to -2}\frac{(t+2)(2t-3)}{(t+2)(t-2)}\\
&= \lim_{t \to -2}\frac{(2t-3)}{(t-2)}\\
&= \frac{2(-2)-3}{(-2)-2}\\
&= \frac{7}{4}
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
When we evaluate the function at <math>t=-2</math> we obtain 0/0. Since this is a rational function, it means that we can factor <math>t+2</math> in each of the denominator and numerator:
:<math>\displaystyle
2t^2+t-6 = (t+2)(2t-3)
</math>
and
:<math>\displaystyle
t^2-4 = (t+2)(t-2)
</math>
Hence
:<math>
\begin{align}
\lim_{t \to -2}\frac{2t^2+t-6}{t^2-4} &= \lim_{t \to -2}\frac{(t+2)(2t-3)}{(t+2)(t-2)}\\
&= \lim_{t \to -2}\frac{(2t-3)}{(t-2)}\\
&= \frac{2(-2)-3}{(-2)-2}\\
&= \frac{7}{4}
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:
Short-Answer Questions. Put your answer in the box provided but show your work also. Each question is worth 3 marks, but not all questions are of equal difficulty. Full marks will be given for correct answers placed in the box, but at most 1 mark will be given for incorrect answers. Unless otherwise stated, it is not necessary to simplify your answers in this question.

Evaluate

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{t \to -2} \frac{2t^2+t-6}{t^2-4}\end{aligned}\]

or determine that the limit does not exist.
